User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

After setting browser.fullscreen.animateUp=2 and while in full screen mode, I move the cursor off the toolbars and back over the toolbars before the autohide animation starts.


Actual results:

The toolbars hid even though the cursor was over them.


Expected results:

The autohide should have canceled when the cursor moved back over the toolbars. Preferably, the autohide delay should also be controllable.

comments.raw_text:
Confirmed. Happens using a new profile and also in safe mode. Also tested on multiple PCs running XP, Vista, and Windows 7. Happens on all of them.

Just to be clear, steps to reproduce are:
1. Set browser.fullscreen.animateUp=2
2. Enter full screen mode (toolbars will slide up as expected.)
3. Mouse up so that toolbars pop up.
4. Quick mouse down off the toolbars and then back up on to the toolbars before they begin the slide up animation. At this point, the toolbars slide up even though the cursor is over them.

I can post a video if necessary.
